data.title: Historical Events in 1961
data.meta_description: Historical events from year 1961. Learn about 581 famous, scandalous and important events that happened in 1961 or search by date or keyword.
data.text:
Events 1 - 200 of 581

Oilers Defeat Chargers

1st AFL Championship, Jeppesen Stadium, Houston; Houston Oilers beat Los Angeles Chargers, 24-16; QB George Blanda 3 TD passes, 3 conversions and a field goal

Jan 1 Briggs Stadium, home of baseball's Detroit Tigers is officially renamed Tigers Stadium

Jan 1 Largest check issued, National Bank of Chicago to Sears ($960.242 billion)

Jan 1 Russia introduces a new ruble worth $1.11

Hawaii's, then all time low temperature, 14°F recorded atop Haleakale

Powell Elected to Committee

Adam Clayton Powell Jr. elected Chairman of US House Education and Labor Committee

Jan 3 An explosion at the Nuclear Reactor Testing Station in Idaho Falls kills three operators

Jan 3 US breaks diplomatic relations with Cuba

Longest recorded strike ends as the Danish barbers' assistants end a 33 year strike

McCartney Plays Bass

The Beatles perform with Paul McCartney on bass guitar for the 1st time, at Litherland Town Hall, in Lancashire, England

1st NFL Playoff Bowl (runner-up bowl)-Detroit beats Cleveland 17-16

Jan 7 Trucial States (now UAE) issue their 1st postage stamps

Bollingen Prize for poetry awarded to Yvor Winters

Jan 8 The French vote for Algerian independence from French rule in the wake of seven years of guerrilla war

Twins agree on $500,000 payment to AA for Minn/St Paul territory

Racial riot at University of Georgia

UN genocide pact goes into effect

Chicago Bear Willard Dewveall becomes 1st NFLer to join AFL

Gordy Signs Supremes

Berry Gordy signs The Supremes to Motown Records

Russian espionage ring detected in Great Britain

Eisenhower's Farewell Address

US President Dwight D. Eisenhower delivers a televised farewell address to the nation three days before leaving office, in which he warns against the accumulation of power by the "military-industrial complex".

Zanzibar's Afro-Shirazi party wins 1 seat by a single vote & parliament by a single seat

"The Dick Van Dyke Show"

1st episode of "The Dick Van Dyke Show" is filmed

JFK Inaugurated

Democrat John F. Kennedy, the youngest elected President of the United States, is administered his oath of office at his inauguration by Supreme Court Chief Justice Earl Warren. Robert Frost recites "Gift Outright".

Djilas Flees

Yugoslav ex-vice-president Milovan Djilas flees

Francis Poulenc's "Gloria" premieres in Boston< Massachusetts by Boston Symphony and Chorus Pro Musica under conductor Charles Münch

Jan 21 KIFI TV channel 8 in Idaho Falls, Idaho (NBC) begins broadcasting

Jan 21 Portuguese rebels seize cruise ship Santa Maria

US Supreme Court rules cities and states have the right to censor films

Jan 23 Venezuela adopts constitution

American Dream

Edward Albee's one-act play "American Dream" premieres in NYC

Jan 24 Lazard Brothers Ltd draw a check for $334,867,807.68

First live, nationally televised presidential news conference, held by JFK

Jan 25 Military coup in El Salvador

101 Dalmatians

Walt Disney's animated film "101 Dalmatians", based on the novel by Dodie Smith and directed by Clyde Geronimi and Hamilton Luske is released in the US

Are You Lonesome Tonight

"Are You Lonesome Tonight?" by Elvis Presley hits #1

Jan 26 1st woman personal physician to a US President - Janet G. Travell (to John F. Kennedy)

"Sing Along with Mitch" [Miller] premieres on NBC TV

"Il trovatore"

Leontyne Price and Franco Corelli make debuts at the Metropolitan Opera in New York in "Il trovatore"; final curtain call lasts 35 minutes

Republic of Rwanda proclaimed

"I Fall to Pieces"

"I Fall to Pieces" single released by Patsy Cline (Billboard Song of the Year 1961)

Jan 30 Bobby Darin is youngest performer to headline a TV special on NBC

Jan 30 JFK asks for an Alliance for Progress & Peace Corps, a $20 billion US Aid program for Latin America

Jan 30 KAET TV channel 8 in Phoenix, AZ (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sports History

Outstanding West Indian spin bowler Lance Gibbs takes hat-trick (Ken Mackay, Wally Grout, Frank Misson) in drawn 4th Test v Australia in Adelaide

Ben-Gurion Resigns

David Ben-Gurion resigns as Prime Minister of Israel

Jan 31 Ham the chimpanzee is 1st primate in space (158 miles) aboard Mercury/Redstone 2

Jan 31 Houston voters approve bond to finance luxury domed stadium

Jan 31 Kanhai completes twin tons (117 & 115) v Aust at Adelaide

Jan 31 NATO Secretary-General Paul-Henri Spaak says he'll resign

Jan 31 USAF launches Samos spy satellite to replace U-2 flights

Jan 31 West Indian cricket batsman Rohan Kanhai scores back-to-back centuries in the drawn 4th Test against Australia in Adelaide; follows 1st innings 117 with 115 in 2nd knock

1st full-scale test of US Minuteman ICBM is successful

Feb 1 Australian cricket tail-enders Ken Mackay (62no) and Lindsay Kline (15no) hang on for 100 minutes to earn a famous draw on the final day vs West Indies in 4th Test in Adelaide

Powell Increases Medical Insurance

British minister Enoch Powell makes medical insurance more expensive

"The Misfits"

John Huston's film drama "The Misfits" officially premieres at the Loews Capitol in NYC, after a sneak preview at Reno, Nevada's Grenada Theatre; the final movie for both Clark Gable and Marilyn Monroe was written by Monroe's husband Arthur Miller, and also featured Montgomery Cliff

Dutch Prince Bernhard opens new RAI building in Amsterdam

6th largest snowfall in NYC history (17.4 inches or 44.2cm)

Anglo War of Independence

Angolan War of Independence begins when militants storm Luanda jail and barracks, trying to free political prisoners (last until 1974)

Feb 4 Sputnik 7 launches into Earth orbit; probable Venus probe failure

"Jail, No Bail" Jail-in movement starts in Rock Hill, South Carolina

Feb 6 KOAP TV channel 10 in Portland, OR (PBS) begins broadcasting

Jane Fonda Debut

Jane Fonda made her acting debut in the NBC drama "A String of Beads"

Joseph Ileo appointed Premier of Congo

Feb 9 The Beatles first gig at Liverpool's Cavern Club; they would play there nearly 300 times over the next two years

AFL's LA Chargers move to San Diego

Feb 10 Niagara Falls hydroelectric project begins producing power

Piston's 7th Symphony

Walter Piston's 7th Symphony, commissioned by the Philadelphia Orchestra premieres under direction of Eugene Ormandy; wins 1961 Pulitzer Prize

Robert Weaver sworn in as Administrator of the Housing and Home Finance Agency, the 1st African American to be appointed to a US cabinet-level position

Sports History

Boston Celtic Bill Russell grabs 40 rebounds to beat Philadelphia Warriors, 136-125

Feb 12 Pakistani cricketer Mushtaq Mohammad scores his 1st test cricket century for Pakistan at 17 years of age

Feb 12 USSR launches Venera 1 toward Venus

Soviet Union fires a rocket from Sputnik V to Venus

Element 103, Lawrencium, 1st produced in Berkeley Calif

Australia beat West Indies 2-1 in one of best Test Cricket series ever

Feb 15 Plane crash kills entire US figure skating team outside Brussels airport in Belgium enroute to World Championships in Prague from NYC; 73 crew and passengers (including 34 American skaters, coaches, officials, and other team members), and a farmer on the ground are lost

1st all-solid-propellant rocket put in orbit, Wallops Island, Virginia

Feb 16 China uses its 1st nuclear reactor

Feb 16 NASA Explorer 9 mission launches satellite for the 1st time from Wallops Flight Facility, Wallops Island, Virginia; this was also the 1st all-solid-propellant rocket put into orbit

Henk van der Grift becomes world champion skater

Albania disavows Chinese "Revisionism"

Feb 19 Dutchman Henk van der Grift becomes world champ all-round skater

Event of Interest

Friedrich Durrenmatt's "Die Physiker" premieres in Zurich

Feb 21 Gabon adopts constitution

Feb 21 Mercury-Atlas 2 reentry Test reaches 172 km

NASA Explorer S-45 mission; ionosphere beacon satellite fails to reach Earth orbit

Niagara ends St Bonaventura's 99-game home college basketball win streak

Feb 25 Paul Bikle in glider climbs from 1,208 m at release to record altitude of 1,410m

3rd Daytona 500: Marvin Panch wins in a 1960 Pontiac owned by Smokey Yunick when race leader Fireball Roberts' car suffered a blown engine with 13 laps remaining

The first congress of the Spanish Trade Union Organisation is inaugurated

Appointment of Interest

US President John F Kennedy names Henry Kissinger special advisor

Cellist Jacqueline du Prés debut in Wigmore Hall

Mar 1 US President JFK establishes the Peace Corps

Hassan II

King Hassan II ascends to throne of Morocco

Paul-Henri Spaak resigns as Secretary-General of NATO

1st London minicabs introduced

Mar 6 Dutch guilder revalued 4.74%

Event of Interest

Dutch Queen Juliana celebrates 12½ year jubilee

Jean Kerr's "Mary, Mary" premieres in NYC

Event of Interest

US nuclear submarine Patrick Henry arrives at Scottish naval base of Holy Loch from South Carolina in a record underseas journey of 66 days 22 hrs

Mine cave-in in Japan, kills 72

Sports History

Philadelphia Warriors center Wilt Chamberlain scores 67 points in 135-126 win over NY Knicks at Philadelphia Civic Center

Sputnik 9 Launched

Soviet flight Sputnik 9 carries and returns from orbit a dog named Chernushka (Blackie), frogs and a guinea pig

I Want a Guy

The Supremes release singles "I Want a Guy" and "Never Again"

Then NHL record 40 penalties, Black Hawks & Maple Leafs (20 each)

Elizabeth Gurley Finn (70) becomes President of US Communist Party

Boxing Title Fight

Floyd Patterson overcomes two 1st round knockdowns to KO Ingemar Johansson in 6 in Miami Beach and retain the world heavyweight boxing crown

Mar 13 JFK sets up the Alliance for Progress

Mar 13 Landslide in USSR, kills 145

Mar 13 Old type, black & white notes cease to be legal tender

Sports History

Former New York Yankees general manager George Weiss becomes first President of New York Mets after MLB expansion franchise formed

South Africa withdraws from British Commonwealth

Event of Interest

Jaguar head William Lyons debuts the first E-Type model at the Geneva International Motor Show, creating a sensation

Mar 17 NY DA arrests professional gamblers who implicate Seton Hall players

Mar 17 South Africa leaves British Commonwealth

Sports History

Art Modell purchases Cleveland Browns for then record sum ($3,925,000)

Mar 21 The Beatles' first appearance at the Cavern Club in Liverpool

NY Senate approves $55M for a baseball stadium at Flushing Meadows

3rd place game is one of the wildest contests in NCAA Tournament history as St Joseph's defeats Utah, 127-120 in quadruple overtime

Mar 25 Elvis Presley performs live at Pearl Harbor’s Bloch Arena in a benefit for the USS Arizona Memorial; his return to the concert stage after a stint in the US Army raises $60K and worldwide awareness of the project [1]

Mar 25 Explorer 10 launched into elongated Earth orbit (177/181,000 km)

Mar 25 Sputnik 10 carries a dog into Earth orbit; later recovered

Black demonstrators in Charleston staged ride-ins on street cars

Mar 27 Failed assassination attempt on King Saif al-Islam Achmad of Yemen

23rd Amendment to the US Constitution ratified, allowing Washington, D.C. residents to vote in presidential elections

Event of Interest

After a 4½ year trial Nelson Mandela is acquitted of treason in Pretoria

Appointment of Interest

Economist John Kenneth Galbraith is appointed US Ambassador to India

Mar 29 KCPT TV channel 19 in Kansas City, MO (PBS) begins broadcasting

Event of Interest

NASA civilian pilot Joseph A. Walker takes X-15 169,600' (51,690 m)

Mar 30 The Single Convention on Narcotic Drugs is signed at New York

Aklilou Habtewold becomes 1st premier of Ethiopia

Connie Mack Stadium in Philadelphia is sold to J Schleifer Properties

TV Show Appearance

Barbra Streisand appears on "Jack Paar Show"

Apr 5 Dutch governor Platteel installs New Guinea Council

British liner "Dara" explodes in Persian Gulf, kills 236

Dutch foreign minister Luns talks to JFK about New Guinea

Apr 10 Washington Senators play first game in franchise history with President John F. Kennedy in attendance; lose a 4-3 decision to the Chicago White Sox

Austrian 4th & last government of Raab resigns

Dylan at Folk City

Bob Dylan makes his 1st appearance at Folk City, Greenwich Village, New York City

Eichmann's War Crimes Trial

Trial of Adolf Eichmann for war crimes in World War II begins in Jerusalem, Israel

Grammy Awards

3rd Grammy Awards: Theme From a Summer Place, Ray Charles wins 4

Sports History

Douglas MacArthur declines offer to become baseball commissioner

Launch of Vostok 1

Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human to travel into space and orbit Earth, aboard the Vostok 1 spacecraft

UN General Assembly condemns South-Africa's apartheid

1st live television broadcast from Soviet Union

Apr 14 Cuban-American invasion army departs Nicaragua

Apr 14 US element 103 (Lawrencium) discovered

15th Tony Awards: "Becket" (play) & "Bye Bye Birdie" (musical) win

Apr 16 Stanley Cup Final, Olympia Stadium, Detroit, MI: Chicago Blackhawks beat Detroit Red Wings, 4-1 for a 4-2 series victory

Event of Interest

1,400 Cuban exiles land in the Bay of Pigs in a doomed attempt to overthrow Fidel Castro

Academy Awards

33rd Academy Awards: "Apartment" wins best film, Burt Lancaster & Elizabeth Taylor win best actor, actress

Apr 17 Construction begins on the Space Needle in Seattle, Washington; 5,850 tons of concreter delivered by 467 trucks over 12 hours for the foundation

Film & TV History

Jimmy Stewart accepts an honorary Oscar on behalf of his friend Gary Cooper, who is too ill to attend

CONCP is founded in Casablanca as a united front of African movements opposing Portuguese colonial rule

American Harold Graham makes 1st rocket belt flight

Dirk Stikker chosen as secretary general of NATO

Apr 21 French army revolts in Algeria

Apr 21 USAF Maj Robert M White takes X-15 to 32,000 m

Uprising of French parachutist of General Salan and Challe in Algeria

Algiers putsch by French generals

Music History

Singer Judy Garland appears in concert at Carnegie Hall, NYC; event is recorded for a double live album, wins Grammy Award for Album of the Year (the first such win by a female artist)

Sinking of the Vasa

17th century Swedish warship Vasa, which sunk on her maiden voyage in 1628, is salvaged

Apr 24 JFK accepts "sole responsibility" following Bay of Pigs

Belgium History

Belgium government of Gaston Eyskens falls over the Unitary Law

Apr 25 France performs nuclear test at Reggane Proving Grounds Algeria

Apr 25 Mercury/Atlas rocket lifted off with an electronic mannequin

Apr 25 Premier Moise Tsjombe of Katanga arrested in Congo

Apr 25 Robert Noyce patents integrated circuit

Apr 25 Unmanned Mercury test explodes on launch pad

French paratroopers' revolt suppressed in Algeria

Baseball History

Roger Maris hits 1st of 61 homers in 1961

NASA launches Explorer 11 into Earth orbit to study gamma rays

Apr 27 NFL officially recognizes Hall of Fame in Canton, Ohio

Apr 27 Sierra Leone declares independence from the United Kingdom

Lt Col Gueorgui Mossolov takes E-66A to 34,714 m altitude

ABC's "Wide World of Sports" debuts

"Tossin' and Turnin'" single released by Bobby Lewis (Billboard Song of the Year, 1961)

Apr 30 1st shuttle flights between Washington, D.C., Boston & NYC begin (Eastern)

LPGA Titleholders Championship Women's Golf, Augusta CC: Mickey Wright wins her 5th major title by 1 stroke from Patty Berg & Louise Suggs

Baseball Record

MLB San Francisco Giants outfielder Willie Mays becomes just the 9th player in MLB history to hit 4 homers in one game in 14-4 win against the Braves in Milwaukee

Apr 30 Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba receives Lenin-Peace Prize

1st US airplane hijacked to Cuba

May 1 Fidel Castro announces there will be no more elections in Cuba

May 1 Tanganyika granted full internal self-government by Britain

1st on-the-road Spacemobile lecture given.

May 4 CORE begins freedom rides from Washington, D.C.

May 4 Malcolm Ross & Victor Prather reach 34,668 m (record) in balloon

May 4 South Africa ANC leader John Nkadimeng arrested

Omer Vanaudenhove chosen chairman of Belgium Liberal Party

1st practical sea water conversion plant-Freeport, Texas

May 8 Alan Shepard receives NASA Distinguished Service Medal, Washington

Baltimore Oriole Jim Gentile hits 2 grand slams (9 RBIs) vs Minnesota Twins

May 9 Jim Gentile is 4th to hit grand slams in consecutive innings

May 9 US Federal Communication Commission (FCC) Chairman Newton N. Minow criticizes TV as a "vast wasteland" during a speech before the National Association of Broadcasters

Sports History

Russian Mikhail Botvinnik wins world chess championship for 3rd time

Bus with 1st group of Freedom Riders bombed & burned in Alabama

Previous

1

2

3

Next
